info.description:
# Introduction

The Scalekit API is a RESTful API that enables you to manage organizations, users, and authentication settings. All requests must use HTTPS.

# Base URL

All API requests use the following base URLs:

```
https://{environment}.scalekit.dev (Development)
https://{environment}.scalekit.com (Production)
https://auth.example.com (Custom domain)
```

Scalekit operates two separate environments: Development and Production. Resources cannot be moved between environments.

# Authentication

The Scalekit API uses OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials for authentication.

Getting an access token

1. Get your credentials from the [Scalekit Dashboard](https://app.scalekit.com):

   - environment
   - client_id
   - client_secret

2. Request an access token:

```shell
curl https://{SCALEKIT_ENVIRONMENT_URL}/oauth/token \
  -X POST \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  -d 'client_id={client_id}' \
  -d 'client_secret={client_secret}' \
  -d 'grant_type=client_credentials'
```

3. Use the access token in API requests:

```shell
curl https://{SCALEKIT_ENVIRONMENT_URL}/api/v1/organizations \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {access_token}'
```

The response includes an access token:

```json
{
	"access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6InNua181Ok4OTEyMjU2NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
	"token_type": "Bearer",
	"expires_in": 86399,
	"scope": "openid"
}
```

# Response Codes

The API uses standard HTTP status codes:

| Code        | Description          |
| ----------- | -------------------- |
| 200/201     | Success              |
| 400         | Invalid request      |
| 401         | Authentication error |
| 404         | Resource not found   |
| 429         | Rate limit exceeded  |
| 500/501/504 | Server error         |

Error responses include detailed information:

```json
{
	"code": 16,
	"message": "Token empty",
	"details": [
		{
			"@type": "type.googleapis.com/scalekit.v1.errdetails.ErrorInfo",
			"error_code": "UNAUTHENTICATED"
		}
	]
}
```
info.title: Scalekit APIs

get.description: Retrieves a list of connections in the environment

parameters.description: Filter connections by organization identifier
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Filter connections by email domain associated with the organization
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of additional fields to include in the response
parameters.name: include

200.description: Successfully retrieved connections

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of organizations within your environment. The response includes a `page_token` that can be used to access subsequent pages of results.

parameters.description: Maximum number of organizations to return per page. Must be between 10 and 100
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Pagination token from the previous response. Use to retrieve the next page of organizations
parameters.name: page_token

parameters.description: Your application's unique identifier for this organization, used to link Scalekit with your system
parameters.name: external_id

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of organizations

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
options = ListOrganizationOptions()
options.page_size = 10

organizations = sc.organization.list_organizations(
  options=options
)

post.description: Creates a new organization in your environment. Use this endpoint to add a new tenant that can be configured with various settings and metadata

parameters.description: Organization details
parameters.name: organization

schema.description: Required parameters for creating a new organization

201.description: Returns the newly created organization with its unique identifier and settings

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
options = CreateOrganizationOptions()
options.external_id = "externalId"
organization = sc.organization.create_organization(
  name,
  options=options
)

x-codeSamples.label: Go SDK

get.description: Retrieves organization details by Scalekit ID, including name, region, metadata, and settings

parameters.description: Unique scalekit-generated identifier that uniquely references an organization
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returns the complete organization object with ID, display name, settings, and metadata

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js SDK
Go SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
sc := scalekit.NewScalekitClient(
  <SCALEKIT_ENVIRONMENT_URL>,
  <SCALEKIT_CLIENT_ID>,
  <SCALEKIT_CLIENT_SECRET>
)

organization, err := sc.Organization.GetOrganization(
  ctx,
  organizationId
)

x-codeSamples.label: Java SDK

delete.description: Remove an existing organization from the environment using its unique identifier

parameters.description: Unique scalekit-generated identifier that uniquely references an organization
parameters.name: id

200.description: Organization successfully deleted and no longer accessible

patch.description: Updates an organization's display name, external ID, or metadata. Requires a valid organization identifier. Region code cannot be modified through this endpoint.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization to be updated
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returns the updated organization with all current details reflected in the response.

x-codeSamples.label: Go SDK
Java SDK

put.description: Creates a time-limited Admin Portal URL for IT administrators to configure and manage Single Sign-On (SSO) connections within their organization. Generated links expire after 7 days (168 hours).

parameters.description: Organization ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
Features to enable in the admin portal link. To enable features, append them as URL parameters:

- Single Sign-On: ?features=sso
- Directory Sync: ?features=dir_sync
- Both features: ?features=sso&features=dir_sync

Example URL: https://scalekit.com/portal/lnk_123?features=sso

 - dir_sync: dir_sync enables directory synchronization configuration in the portal
 - sso: sso enables Single Sign-On (SSO) configuration in the portal
parameters.name: features

200.description: Admin Portal link generated successfully. Returns the portal URL and expiration timestamp.

patch.description: Updates configuration settings for an organization. Supports modifying SSO configuration, directory synchronization settings, and session parameters. Requires organization ID and the specific settings to update.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization to update settings. Must begin with 'org_' prefix
parameters.name: id

schema.description: Settings configuration to apply to the organization. Contains feature toggles for SSO, directory synchronization, and other organization capabilities

200.description: Returns the complete organization object with updated settings applied. Contains all organization details including ID, display name, and the modified settings.

400.description: Invalid request - occurs when the settings payload contains invalid values or unsupported configuration

404.description: Organization not found - the specified organization ID doesn't exist

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js SDK
Go SDK
Java SDK

get.description: Retrieves the complete configuration and status details for a specific connection by its ID within an organization. Returns all connection properties including provider settings, protocols, and current status.

parameters.description: Organization identifier (required). Specifies which organization owns the connection you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Connection identifier (required). Specifies which specific connection to retrieve from the organization.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Successfully retrieved connection details for the specified organization

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js SDK
Go SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
connection, err := sc.Connection.GetConnection(
  ctx,
  organizationId,
  connectionId,
)

patch.description: Deactivate an existing connection for the specified organization. When disabled, users cannot authenticate using this connection. This endpoint changes the connection state from enabled to disabled without modifying other configuration settings

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization associated with the connection
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the connection to be toggled
parameters.name: id

200.description: Connection disabled successfully

patch.description: Activate an existing connection for the specified organization. When enabled, users can authenticate using this connection. This endpoint changes the connection state from disabled to enabled without modifying other configuration settings

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization associated with the connection
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the connection to be toggled
parameters.name: id

200.description: Connection enabled successfully

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of directories for the organization

get.description: Retrieves all groups from a specified directory. Use this endpoint to view group structures from your connected identity provider.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the directory
parameters.name: directory_id

parameters.description: Number of groups to return per page. Maximum value is 30. If not specified, defaults to 10
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Token for pagination. Use the value returned in the 'next_page_token' field of the previous response
parameters.name: page_token

parameters.description: Filter groups updated after this timestamp. Use ISO 8601 format
parameters.name: updated_after

parameters.description: If true, includes full group details. If false or not specified, returns basic information only
parameters.name: include_detail

parameters.description: If true, returns group and its details from external provider (default: false)
parameters.name: include_external_groups

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of groups from the specified directory

x-codeSamples.label: Go SDK
Java SDK

get.description: Retrieves a list of all users within a specified directory for an organization. This endpoint allows you to view user accounts associated with your connected Directory Providers.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the directory within the organization
parameters.name: directory_id

parameters.description: Number of users to return per page. Maximum value is 30. If not specified, defaults to 10
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Token for pagination. Use the value returned in the 'next_page_token' field of the previous response to retrieve the next page of results
parameters.name: page_token

parameters.description: If set to true, the response will include the full user payload with all available details. If false or not specified, only essential user information will be returned
parameters.name: include_detail

parameters.description: Filter users by their membership in a specific directory group
parameters.name: directory_group_id

parameters.description: Filter users that were updated after the specified timestamp. Use ISO 8601 format
parameters.name: updated_after

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of users from the specified directory

x-codeSamples.label: Go SDK
Java SDK

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific directory within an organization

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the directory
parameters.name: id

200.description: Successfully retrieved directory details

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js SDK
Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
directory = sc.directory.get_directory(
  directory_id='<directory_id>', organization_id='<organization_id>'
)
print(f'Directory details: {directory}')

patch.description: Stops synchronization of users and groups from a specified directory within an organization. This operation prevents further updates from the connected Directory provider

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the organization. The value must begin with 'org_' and be between 1 and 32 characters long
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: A unique identifier for a directory within the organization. The value must begin with 'dir_' and be between 1 and 32 characters long
parameters.name: id

200.description: Successfully disabled the directory

patch.description: Activates a directory within an organization, allowing it to synchronize users and groups with the connected Directory provider

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the organization. The value must begin with 'org_' and be between 1 and 32 characters long
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: A unique identifier for a directory within the organization. The value must begin with 'dir_' and be between 1 and 32 characters long
parameters.name: id

200.description: Success

post.description: Creates a new M2M client for an organization. This endpoint registers a new client application that can securely access your API on behalf of the organization. The response includes a client ID and secret that should be used for OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow. The plain secret is only returned once during creation and must be stored securely.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

schema.description: Details of the client to be created

201.description: M2M client created successfully. Returns the client ID and plain secret (only available at creation time). The client can be configured with scopes, audience values, and custom claims for fine-grained access control.

get.description: Retrieves the configuration details for an organization's M2M client. This endpoint returns the client's metadata, including its scopes, audience values, custom claims, and associated secrets. Use this to verify client settings or retrieve the list of active secrets.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the M2M client
parameters.name: client_id

200.description: Returns the complete M2M client configuration, including all current settings and a list of active secrets. Note that secret values are not included in the response for security reasons.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an M2M client from an organization. This operation cannot be undone and will revoke all access for the client. All associated secrets will also be invalidated. Use this endpoint to remove unused or compromised clients.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization that owns the client. Must start with 'org_' prefix.
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the M2M client to permanently delete. Must start with 'm2morg_' prefix.
parameters.name: client_id

200.description: Organization M2M client successfully deleted and no longer accessible

patch.description: Updates the configuration settings for an organization's M2M client. This endpoint allows you to modify client properties such as scopes, audience values, and custom claims. Use this to adjust access permissions or update metadata for the client. Note that client_id and create_time are immutable and cannot be modified.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client
parameters.name: client_id

200.description: Returns the updated organization M2M client with all current details reflected in the response, including modified scopes, audience values, and custom claims.

post.description: Generates a new client secret for an organization's M2M client. This endpoint creates a secure credential that can be used for OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow. The plain secret is only returned once during creation and should be stored securely by the client application. Use this endpoint to rotate secrets or create additional credentials for different environments.
post.summary: Create a Secret for Organization M2M Client

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client
parameters.name: client_id

201.description: Client secret created successfully. Returns the new secret ID and the plain secret value (only available at creation time). The secret can be used immediately for authentication.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a client secret for an organization's M2M client. This operation cannot be undone. Use this endpoint to remove compromised or unused secrets. After deletion, the secret can no longer be used for authentication. Consider creating a new secret before deleting the old one to avoid service interruption.
delete.summary: Delete an Organization M2M Client Secret

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client secret
parameters.name: secret_id

200.description: Client secret successfully deleted and no longer accessible

post.description: Creates a new M2M client for an organization. This endpoint registers a new client application that can securely access your API on behalf of the organization. The response includes a client ID and secret that should be used for OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow. The plain secret is only returned once during creation and must be stored securely.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

schema.description: Details of the client to be created

201.description: M2M client created successfully. Returns the client ID and plain secret (only available at creation time). The client can be configured with scopes, audience values, and custom claims for fine-grained access control.

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
from scalekit.v1.clients.clients_pb2 import OrganizationClient

m2m_client = OrganizationClient(
    name="GitHub Actions Deployment Service",
    description="Service account for GitHub Actions to deploy applications to production",
    custom_claims=[
        {"key": "github_repository", "value": "acmecorp/inventory-service"},
        {"key": "environment", "value": "production_us"}
    ],
    scopes=["deploy:applications", "read:deployments"],
    audience=["deployment-api.acmecorp.com"],
    expiry=3600
)

response = sc.m2m_client.create_organization_client(
    organization_id="SCALEKIT_ORGANIZATION_ID",
    m2m_client=m2m_client
)

get.description: Retrieves the configuration details for an organization's M2M client. This endpoint returns the client's metadata, including its scopes, audience values, custom claims, and associated secrets. Use this to verify client settings or retrieve the list of active secrets.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the M2M client
parameters.name: client_id

200.description: Returns the complete M2M client configuration, including all current settings and a list of active secrets. Note that secret values are not included in the response for security reasons.

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
# Get client ID from environment variables
org_id = 'SCALEKIT_ORGANIZATION_ID'
client_id = os.environ['M2M_CLIENT_ID']

# Fetch client details for the specified organization
response = sc.m2m_client.get_organization_client(
    organization_id=org_id,
    client_id=client_id
)

delete.description: Permanently deletes an M2M client from an organization. This operation cannot be undone and will revoke all access for the client. All associated secrets will also be invalidated. Use this endpoint to remove unused or compromised clients.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization that owns the client. Must start with 'org_' prefix.
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the M2M client to permanently delete. Must start with 'm2morg_' prefix.
parameters.name: client_id

200.description: Organization M2M client successfully deleted and no longer accessible

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
# Get client ID from environment variables
org_id = '<SCALEKIT_ORGANIZATION_ID>'
client_id = os.environ['M2M_CLIENT_ID']

# Delete the specified client from the organization
response = sc.m2m_client.delete_organization_client(
    organization_id=org_id,
    client_id=client_id
)

patch.description: Updates the configuration settings for an organization's M2M client. This endpoint allows you to modify client properties such as scopes, audience values, and custom claims. Use this to adjust access permissions or update metadata for the client. Note that client_id and create_time are immutable and cannot be modified.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client
parameters.name: client_id

200.description: Returns the updated organization M2M client with all current details reflected in the response, including modified scopes, audience values, and custom claims.

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
from scalekit.v1.clients.clients_pb2 import OrganizationClient

org_id = '<SCALEKIT_ORGANIZATION_ID>'
client_id = os.environ['M2M_CLIENT_ID']

update_m2m_client = OrganizationClient(
    description="Service account for GitHub Actions to deploy applications to production_eu",
    custom_claims=[
        {"key": "github_repository", "value": "acmecorp/inventory"},
        {"key": "environment", "value": "production_eu"}
    ]
)

response = sc.m2m_client.update_organization_client(
    organization_id=org_id,
    client_id=client_id,
    m2m_client=update_m2m_client
)

post.description: Generates a new client secret for an organization's M2M client. This endpoint creates a secure credential that can be used for OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow. The plain secret is only returned once during creation and should be stored securely by the client application. Use this endpoint to rotate secrets or create additional credentials for different environments.
post.summary: Create a Secret for Organization M2M Client

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client
parameters.name: client_id

201.description: Client secret created successfully. Returns the new secret ID and the plain secret value (only available at creation time). The secret can be used immediately for authentication.

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
# Get client ID from environment variables
org_id = 'SCALEKIT_ORGANIZATION_ID'
client_id = os.environ['M2M_CLIENT_ID']

# Add a new secret to the specified client
response = sc.m2m_client.add_organization_client_secret(
    organization_id=org_id,
    client_id=client_id
)

# Extract the secret ID from the response
secret_id = response[0].secret.id

delete.description: Permanently deletes a client secret for an organization's M2M client. This operation cannot be undone. Use this endpoint to remove compromised or unused secrets. After deletion, the secret can no longer be used for authentication. Consider creating a new secret before deleting the old one to avoid service interruption.
delete.summary: Delete an Organization M2M Client Secret

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the client secret
parameters.name: secret_id

200.description: Client secret successfully deleted and no longer accessible

x-codeSamples.label: Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
# Get client and secret IDs from environment variables
org_id = '<SCALEKIT_ORGANIZATION_ID>'
client_id = os.environ['M2M_CLIENT_ID']
secret_id = os.environ['M2M_SECRET_ID']

# Remove the specified secret from the client
response = sc.m2m_client.remove_organization_client_secret(
    organization_id=org_id,
    client_id=client_id,
    secret_id=secret_id
)

post.description: Send a verification email containing either a verification code (OTP), magic link, or both to a user's email address

200.description: Successfully sent passwordless authentication email. Returns the authentication request details including expiration time and request identifier

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js SDK

post.description: Resend a verification email if the user didn't receive it or if the previous code/link has expired

200.description: Successfully resent the passwordless authentication email. Returns updated authentication request details with new expiration time.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js SDK

post.description: Verify a user's identity using either a verification code or magic link token

200.description: Successfully verified the passwordless authentication. Returns user email

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js SDK

auth_request_id.description: The authentication request identifier returned from the send passwordless email endpoint. Required when verifying OTP codes to link the verification with the original request.

code.description: The Verification Code (OTP) received via email. This is typically a 6-digit numeric code that users enter manually to verify their identity.

link_token.description: The unique token from the magic link URL received via email. Extract this token when users click the magic link and are redirected to your application to later verify the user.

email.description: Email address of the successfully authenticated user. This confirms which email account was verified through the passwordless flow.

passwordless_type.description: The type of passwordless authentication that was successfully verified, confirming which method the user completed.

state.description: The custom state parameter that was provided in the original authentication request, returned unchanged. Use this to restore your application's context after authentication.

template.description: Specifies which email template to choose. For User Signin choose SIGNIN and for User Signup use SIGNUP

auth_request_id.description: The authentication request identifier from the original send passwordless email request. Use this to resend the Verification Code (OTP) or Magic Link to the same email address.

email.description: Email address where the passwordless authentication credentials will be sent. Must be a valid email format.

expires_in.description: Time in seconds until the passwordless authentication expires. If not specified, defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes)

magiclink_auth_uri.description: Your application's callback URL where users will be redirected after clicking the magic link in their email. The link token will be appended as a query parameter as link_token

state.description: Custom state parameter that will be returned unchanged in the verification response. Use this to maintain application state between the authentication request and callback, such as the intended destination after login

template.description: Specifies the authentication intent for the passwordless request. Use SIGNIN for existing users or SIGNUP for new user registration. This affects the email template and user experience flow.

auth_request_id.description: Unique identifier for this passwordless authentication request. Use this ID to resend emails.

expires_at.description: Unix timestamp (seconds since epoch) when the passwordless authentication will expire. After this time, the OTP or magic link will no longer be valid.

expires_in.description: Number of seconds from now until the passwordless authentication expires. This is a convenience field calculated from the expires_at timestamp.

passwordless_type.description: Type of passwordless authentication that was sent via email. OTP sends a numeric code, LINK sends a clickable magic link, and LINK_OTP provides both options for user convenience.

attribute_mapping.description: Maps identity provider attributes to user profile fields. For example, {'email': 'user.mail', 'name': 'user.displayName'}.

configuration_type.description: How the connection was configured: DISCOVERY (automatic configuration) or MANUAL (administrator configured)

debug_enabled.description: Enables testing mode that allows non-HTTPS endpoints. Should only be enabled in development environments, never in production.

enabled.description: Controls whether users can sign in using this connection. When false, the connection exists but cannot be used for authentication.

id.description: Unique identifier for this connection. Used in API calls to reference this specific connection.

key_id.description: Alternative identifier for this connection, typically used in frontend applications or URLs.

oauth_config.description: Configuration details for OAuth connections. Present only when type is OAUTH.

oidc_config.description: Configuration details for OpenID Connect (OIDC) connections. Present only when type is OIDC.

organization_id.description: Identifier of the organization that owns this connection. Connections are typically scoped to a single organization.

passwordless_config.description: Configuration details for Magic Link authentication. Present only when type is MAGIC_LINK.

provider.description: Identity provider service that handles authentication (such as OKTA, Google, Azure AD, or a custom provider)

saml_config.description: Configuration details for SAML connections. Present only when type is SAML.

status.description: Current configuration status of the connection. Possible values include IN_PROGRESS, CONFIGURED, and ERROR.

test_connection_uri.description: URI that can be used to test this connection. Visit this URL to verify the connection works correctly.

type.description: Authentication protocol used by this connection. Can be OIDC (OpenID Connect), SAML, OAUTH, or MAGIC_LINK.

connection.description: Complete connection details including provider configuration, protocol settings, status, and all metadata. Contains everything needed to understand the connection's current state.

OrganizationName.description: Name of the organization of the connection

domains.description: List of domains configured with this connection

enabled.description: Whether the connection is currently active for organization users

organization_id.description: Unique identifier of the organization that owns this connection

provider.description: Identity provider type (e.g., OKTA, Google, Azure AD)

status.description: Current configuration status of the connection

type.description: Authentication protocol used by the connection

connections.description: List of connections matching the request criteria

backchannel_logout_redirect_uri.description: backchannel logout redirect uri where idp sends logout_token

enabled.description: Current state of the connection after the operation. True means the connection is now enabled and can be used for authentication.

error_message.description: Error message if the operation fails

attribute_mappings.description: Mappings between directory attributes and Scalekit user and group attributes

directory_endpoint.description: The endpoint URL generated by Scalekit for synchronizing users and groups from the Directory Provider

directory_provider.description: Identity provider connected to this directory

directory_type.description: Type of the directory, indicating the protocol or standard used for synchronization

email.description: Email Id associated with Directory whose access will be used for polling

enabled.description: Indicates whether the directory is currently enabled and actively synchronizing users and groups

groups_tracked.description: It indicates if all groups are tracked or select groups are tracked

last_synced_at.description: Timestamp of the last successful synchronization of users and groups from the Directory Provider

name.description: Name of the directory, typically representing the connected Directory provider

organization_id.description: Unique identifier of the organization to which the directory belongs

role_assignments.description: Role assignments associated with the directory, defining group based role assignments

secrets.description: List of secrets used for authenticating and synchronizing with the Directory Provider

stats.description: Statistics and metrics related to the directory, such as synchronization status and error counts

total_groups.description: Total number of groups in the directory

total_users.description: Total number of users in the directory

directory.description: Detailed information about the requested directory

directories.description: List of directories associated with the organization

groups.description: List of directory groups retrieved from the specified directory

next_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results. Use this token in the 'page_token' field of the next request

prev_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the previous page of results. Use this token in the 'page_token' field of the next request

total_size.description: Total number of groups matching the request criteria, regardless of pagination

next_page_token.description: Token for pagination. Use this token in the 'page_token' field of the next request to fetch the subsequent page of users

prev_page_token.description: Token for pagination. Use this token in the 'page_token' field of the next request to fetch the prior page of users

total_size.description: Total number of users available in the directory that match the request criteria

users.description: List of directory users retrieved from the specified directory

group_id.description: group ID for the role mapping

group_updated_at.description: Max time of Group Updated At for Directory

user_updated_at.description: Max time of User Updated At for Directory

enabled.description: Specifies the directory's state after the toggle operation. A value of `true` indicates that the directory is enabled and actively synchronizing users and groups. A value of `false` means the directory is disabled, halting synchronization

error_message.description: Contains a human-readable error message if the toggle operation encountered an issue. If the operation was successful, this field will be empty

organization.description: The newly created organization containing its ID, settings, and metadata

organizationsFeature.description:
- dir_sync: dir_sync enables directory synchronization configuration in the portal
 - sso: sso enables Single Sign-On (SSO) configuration in the portal
organizationsFeature.title: Feature represents the available features that can be enabled for an organization's portal link

link.description: Contains the generated admin portal link details. The link URL can be shared with organization administrators to set up: Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication and directory synchronization

expire_time.description: Expiry time of the link. The link is valid for 1 week.

location.description: Location of the link. This is the URL that can be used to access the Admin portal. The link is valid for 1 week.

next_page_token.description: Pagination token for the next page of results. Use this token to fetch the next page.

prev_page_token.description: Pagination token for the previous page of results. Use this token to fetch the previous page.

total_size.description: Total number of organizations in the environment.

create_time.description: Timestamp when the organization was created
create_time.title: Created Time

display_name.description: Name of the organization. Must be between 1 and 200 characters
display_name.title: Name of the org to be used in display

external_id.description: Your application's unique identifier for this organization, used to link Scalekit with your system.
external_id.title: External Id is useful to store a unique identifier for a given Org that. The unique Identifier can be the id of your tenant / org in your SaaSApp

id.description: Unique scalekit-generated identifier that uniquely references an organization
id.title: Id

region_code.description: Geographic region code for the organization. Currently limited to US.
region_code.title: Optional regioncode

update_time.description: Timestamp when the organization was last updated
update_time.title: Updated time

organizationsOrganizationSettings.description: Configuration options that control organization-level features and capabilities
organizationsOrganizationSettings.title: Organization Settings

features.description: List of feature toggles that control organization capabilities such as SSO authentication and directory synchronization

organizationsOrganizationSettingsFeature.description: Controls the activation state of a specific organization feature
organizationsOrganizationSettingsFeature.title: Organization Feature Toggle

enabled.description: Whether the feature is enabled (true) or disabled (false) for this organization

name.description: Feature identifier. Supported values include: "sso" (Single Sign-On), "directory_sync" (Directory Synchronization)

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

display_name.description: Name of the organization. Must be between 1 and 200 characters.

external_id.description: Your application's unique identifier for this organization, used to link Scalekit with your system.

v1organizationsUpdateOrganization.description: For update messages ensure the indexes are same as the base model itself.

display_name.description: Name of the organization to display in the UI. Must be between 1 and 200 characters

external_id.description: Your application's unique identifier for this organization, used to link Scalekit with your system

metadata.description: Custom key-value pairs to store with the organization. Keys must be 3-25 characters, values must be 1-256 characters. Maximum 10 pairs allowed.

tags.description: Organization represents a customer or a tenant of your product. This is the top level entity and all resources are mapped to this Organization object. Each organization is uniquely identified by `organization_id`.
tags.name: Organizations

tags.description: The Directory API lets you connect external identity providers to your organizations. Use these endpoints to view users and groups, enable or disable directory connections, and configure access settings. Supports identity systems like Okta, Microsoft Entra ID, and Google Workspace through standard protocols.
tags.name: Directory

tags.description: Connection represents a unique Single Sign-on instance for an Organization. Connection has the configuration needed to establish an SSO and exchange user information securely between Scalekit and your customer's Identity Provider. Depending on the connection type parameter, the corresponding configuration details are found in `oidc_config` or `saml_config` parameter.
tags.name: Connections
